start.title: Getting Started
start.description: CryptoKey allows you to hide sensitive data (like mnemonics) within decoy data using standard encryption or dual-authenticator protection.
steps: Select a mode (Standard or Dual Authenticator).
Save the output safely (QR codes or text).

coreConcept.title: Core Concept
coreConcept.description: Unlike standard encryption, this mode requires Two Separate Keys (Key A & Key B) to decrypt. It splits trust between two different authenticator tokens/devices.

encryption.title: 1. Encryption (Generation)
encryption.step2: Scan the two generated QR codes (Key A & Key B) with your Google Authenticator app. Save these QR images! They are your permanent keys.
encryption.step3: Enter the 6-digit codes from your app to verify and lock the encryption.
encryption.step4: Download the generated Shard Images (QR Sharding).

decryption.title: 2. Decryption (Recovery)

important.title: Important: Keys vs Codes
important.content:
Key (QR/Secret): The permanent "Key" you scanned. Required for decryption.
Code (6-digits): The temporary "Token" generated every 30s. Used only for verification.
important.note: * You CANNOT decrypt with just the 6-digit code. You MUST upload the Key QR or input the Secret string.

decryption.step2: REQUIRED: Upload Key A & Key B QR images (or paste the Secret strings).
decryption.step3: (Optional) Enter current 6-digit codes to verify correctness.

lost.title: 3. Lost your QR Images?
lost.description: If you still have the Authenticator App on your phone:
steps: This will show a QR code containing your Secrets.
Scan/Decode that export QR to get your Secret string back.

mode.title: 1. Choose Protection Mode
mode.description: Select the best way to secure your mnemonic phrase or data:

physical.title: Mnemonic / Physical Book
physical.desc: Hide your key in a real book on your shelf. (Page-Line-Word)

online.title: Online Book (URL)
online.desc: Use a permanent Gutenberg URL as your key source. No files needed.

digital.desc: Upload a Gutenberg TXT file. Processed locally, never uploaded.

index.title: General Index
index.desc: Encrypt arbitrary data structures (e.g., Bank Info, Passwords).

obfuscate.title: 2. Enter & Obfuscate
obfuscate.description: Input your sensitive data. We will then ask you to set a <0>Row Density</0> (e.g., 100 rows). Your real data will be hidden in one random row among 99 fake rows.

export.title: 3. Export & Save
export.description: Once encrypted, you will receive a ciphertext block. You must save this block!

publicComputer.title: Public Computer Safety
publicComputer.description: If you are using a public computer (internet cafe, library, friend's PC):
steps: Do NOT log in to your personal email.
Do NOT use the clipboard (copy/paste) if possible.
Use the "Public Computer Mode" toggle on the result page.
Download the file to a USB drive or scan the QR code with your phone.

military.title: Military-Grade Encryption
military.description: We use AES-256-GCM encryption. This is the same standard used by governments and banks. Your password is salted and hashed using PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA256 with 100,000 iterations, making brute-force attacks nearly impossible.

zk.title: Zero-Knowledge Architecture
zk.description: Everything happens in your browser. We have no servers, no database, and no logs. If you close this tab, your data is gone forever unless you saved the backup.

deniability.title: Plausible Deniability
deniability.description: We generate fake decoy rows indistinguishable from your real data. Even if someone forces you to decrypt the file, you can claim any of the fake rows is the "real" one, or that the file contains no meaningful data at all. The encryption math hides which row is real.

transparency.title: Code Transparency
transparency.description: CryptoKey is a pure client-side application. You can inspect the source code in your browser's developer tools. We encourage security audits. No external scripts or analytics are loaded.

step1.title: Select Mode
step1.description: Choose the same mode used for encryption (Physical, File, or URL). If using File or URL, you must provide the exact same source book.

step2.title: Paste Ciphertext
step2.description: Copy the entire ciphertext block (including the random characters) from your email or file.

step3.title: Enter Password
step3.description: Input the password you set during encryption.

step4.title: Identify Your Row
step4.description: The system will decrypt ALL rows (real + fake). You must remember which row number was yours (e.g., Row 35) to find your data.

aes.title: AES-256-GCM Encryption
aes.desc: Your data is encrypted using the strongest standard available (Web Crypto API). We use PBKDF2 with 100,000 iterations for key derivation.

steganography.title: Book Cipher Steganography
steganography.desc: Hides sensitive data within regular book text (Gutenberg/Physical). Attackers see only harmless page/line/word indices, not ciphertext.

dual.title: Dual-Factor & Sharding
dual.desc: New Dual Authenticator mode splits encryption between two separate keys (A & B), plus QR Sharding for redundancy. Even if one key is compromised, your data remains safe.

zk.title: Zero-Knowledge
zk.desc: We never see your password or data. Everything happens locally in your browser. No data is ever sent to our servers.

noPersistence.title: No Persistence
noPersistence.desc: We do not use cookies, local storage, or server databases. Digital Books (TXT) are processed locally and never uploaded.

antiTheft.title: Anti-Theft Protection
antiTheft.desc: Input fields prevent autocomplete and caching. Memory is actively cleared when you leave. Safe for public computers.

about.title: About Steganography
about.text: This tool hides your data in the least significant bits (LSB) of the image pixels. The resulting image looks identical to the human eye but contains your secret message.
about.noteText: Do not compress the downloaded image (e.g., sending via WhatsApp/Messenger often compresses images). Always share as a file (Document) or keep strictly local.

fileVault.title: File Vault
fileVault.description: Encrypt and shard multiple files into multiple secure file fragments.
fileVault.encryptDesc: Combine multiple files into a single encrypted package, with optional sharding for distributed storage.
fileVault.decryptDesc: Restore your files from a single encrypted package or multiple shards.

warning.title: Important Security Reminders
warning.password: If you lose your password or key file, the data cannot be recovered. Please store them safely.
warning.sharding: Payload sharding splits encrypted data into multiple parts for distributed storage. All parts are needed to decrypt.

about.title: About File Vault
about.text: File Vault allows you to pack multiple files into a single encrypted package. You can enable payload sharding to split the result into multiple parts for distributed storage (e.g., cloud services). Multi-Key mode uses Shamir Secret Sharing to require multiple key files for decryption.
about.note: Always keep backups of your password and key files. If using sharding, store parts in different locations. For maximum security, combine password + key file + sharding.

tip.compression: Compression is enabled by default to reduce file size before encryption.
tip.shamir: Multi-Key mode provides distributed trust - no single key file can decrypt the data alone.

imageVault.title: Image Vault
imageVault.description: Hide any file within an image using advanced steganography.
imageVault.hideDesc: Select a carrier image and files to hide. The files will be encrypted and embedded invisibly.
imageVault.extractDesc: Upload an image containing hidden files to recover them.
imageVault.aboutText: Image steganography hides data invisibly within image pixels.
imageVault.aboutNote: The carrier image will be slightly modified but visually identical.

warning.title: Critical Image Steganography Rules
warning.capacity: Image capacity depends on resolution. Higher resolution = more storage space. If capacity is exceeded, choose a larger image.
warning.format: The output is always PNG format. Do not convert to JPG or compress, as this will destroy hidden data permanently.
warning.transfer: When sharing, always use "Send as File" or "Original Quality". Social media platforms compress images and will destroy hidden data.

tip.carrier: Choose a complex image (photos, landscapes) rather than simple graphics for better steganography.
tip.security: For maximum security, enable password + key file + multi-key sharding.

videoVault.hideDesc: Select a carrier video and files to hide. The files will be appended to the video securely.
videoVault.extractDesc: Upload a video containing hidden files to recover them.
videoVault.aboutText: Video steganography appends encrypted data after video frames.
videoVault.aboutNote: The video can be played normally, hidden data is at the end.

warning.title: Important Video Steganography Warnings
warning.format: Hidden data is appended to the video file. Do not re-encode, compress, or change the video format, as this will destroy the hidden data.
warning.transfer: When sharing, always transfer as original file. Video streaming platforms re-encode videos and will destroy hidden data.
warning.size: The output video size will be slightly larger (by the size of hidden files). This is normal and expected.

tip.carrier: Any video format works (MP4, WebM, etc.). The hidden data is format-independent.
tip.detection: Video steganography is highly covert - the video plays normally and file size increase is minimal.

sharding.note: The file will be split into N parts. All parts are required to recover the file.
